reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Support for UNESCO's Global Education Monitoring Report

description.narrative: The Global Education Monitoring Report (GEM formerly known as the Education for All Global Monitoring Report) is an editorially independent authoritative and evidence-based annual report published by UNESCO. Its mandate is to monitor progress towards the e ducation targets of the Sustainable Development Goals. The substance of the GEM Report is developed and its quality assured by an experienced team under the leadership of the GEM Report Director. 12 reports were produced since 2002 covering themes ranging from inequality gender and teaching and learning to conflict literacy and early childhood care and education. It is based on UNESCO's Statistical Institute's statistics. UN organizations the WB Global Partnership for Education NGO developing countries and donors are represented in its Advisory Board. Finland supports GEM 2016-2017 by EUR 100 000.
